block.p: Office.com, New York, a unit of Winstar Communications, a Web site that offers content and services to small businesses, to the New York office of TBWA/Chiat/Day, part of the TBWA Worldwide unit of the Omnicom Group, to handle advertising, which had been at Cliff Freeman & Partners , New York, and Darwin Digital, New York, part of Saatchi & Saatchi P.L.C. Billings were estimated at $30 million. Eric Jones, a spokesman at Office.com, confirmed a report of the decision this week in Adweek.

Schwan's Sales Enterprises, Marshall, Minn., to Campbell Mithun, Minneapolis, part of the Interpublic Group of Cos., to handle the account for its Schwan's Home Service and Tony's Pizza Service divisions. Billings were estimated at $17 million to $20 million. Campbell Mithun is the first agency for Schwan's Home Service; Tony's Pizza had been at the Minneapolis office of the Bozell Group, part of True North Communications.

Hoover's, Austin, Tex., to Publicis in Mid America, Dallas, part of Publicis Groupe S.A., as the agency of record to handle its account, which includes Hoover's Online. The account, with billings estimated at $10 million to $12 million, had been at GSD&M, Austin, part of the Omnicom Group, for about a year.

Eisner Communications, was named the agency to handle two accounts, with combined billings estimated at $10 million. One was the Century Council, Washington, a nonprofit organization that promotes responsible alcohol consumption, which had been at MGH Advertising, Owings Mills, Md.; the other was Vitalspring.com, Bethesda, Md., part of Medical Internet Solutions, a Web site that offers health care information, for its first account.
DGNonline, New York, which offers Web services for the graphic arts industry, to Bonnell Vila Zahor, New York, to handle its first account, with billings estimated at $2 million to $5 million.
